name: Retro Attorney
description:
This is a currently incomplete game intended to be in the style of the Ace Attorney series, but absurdly low-res. The idea was to make a serious drama/satire juxtaposed with presentation that makes no sense.

The current build doesn't work and was uploaded basically just because the game jam that inspired it (which should be displayed automatically) was about to end. A whole bunch of things went wrong during the 2-week time period, including me suffering a back injury, and by the time I finally got to making a build of the engine, I found out the menu system flat-out didn't work. I tried skipping over the main menu straight to new-game only to find out the text didn't work either.

I plan to keep working on this, if only because the intended story is enjoyable to work on, but unfortunately, it's not in a state where anyone else can enjoy the story yet. I also intend to adjust how the images are accomplished (they're procedural, not embedded or external) to get the file size down to a more sensible level.
